comments: Consider from A061037, Balmer, A145980 (29,139,323,581,) mod 9 = period9:repeat 2,4,8,5,4,5,8,4,2 (palindrom) = A146079. a(n)=A146079(1),A146079(4),A146079(7),A146079(10), .. generally A146079(3n+1 or A016777). - _Paul Curtz_, Nov 01 2008From _Klaus Brockhaus_, May 25 2010: (Start)Continued fraction expansion of 2+sqrt(5).Decimal expansion of 4/9.Inverse binomial transform of A020707. (End)
